comment: I would not recommend taking this professor for a online classes. his lectures are very long and hard to follow. The only thing I struggle with in this class are the test. They have a small number of questions and stray from how the homework is laid out. I would recommend this class to someone who is already very knowledgeable in calc 2.

He genuinely cares about the success of students and will help as much as possible. Short quizzes every Thursday but they are generally easy and there is not a lot of homework. Provides guided notes and is almost always accessible after class. Honestly just an incredible professor and I would take him for any of my future math classes if possible.
I averaged a 99 in Calculus 2 with this dude if that tells you anything

Professor D is a great professor, I was a bit worried about calculus when starting it this semester, but he explains things very thoroughly. I can confidently say if I had a worse professor, I probably would have a low B in the class. He puts a lot of effort in for the course and if you put effort in back you can easily receive a high B to an A.

You can really tell that Professor Deutsch cares about his students. He explains things very thoroughly and really goes above and beyond to ensure the success of each and every person. Last semester, I failed calculus and had to withdraw from the class under another professor. After taking Professor Deutsch, I have an A+ in the class. Take him!!

He really cares about the success of his students, and he is open to feedback. Tests are very easy as long as you complete the homework and understand the material. He is easy to contact outside of class.

Professor Deutsch was a good lecturer, I found that because of his personality/cadence I was able to stay focused on material that could be a little tricky. Appreciated that he took time to thoughtfully answer questions in class instead of glossing over them and also found the online review sessions before exams extremely helpful.

I loved this professor! Did a great job of explaining things and offered lots of time outside of class to help you with what you need. I would absolutely take a class with this professor again. He gives half credit on a lot of things.

Prof Deutsch was great! He's a really nice guy and you can tell that he really likes teaching. Very helpful outside of class during office hours. This was a hard class, but it was more because of the math than it was the professor.

overall, he's just ok. his lectures are good, but for some reason he always was going a few minutes over when class was supposed to end and I didn't really care for how we got really no time during class to actually see if we knew the material. there's also a quiz every Friday which was pretty annoying. he's helpful in office hours, but hes just ok
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He is a great teacher. Even though his lectures tend to be a little tricky, its worth noting that if you put in good effort to study material outside the class you would excel in his class.

Hes great at explaining the topics and very thorough in his examples. Homework questions were always harder than the tests. He gave weekly quizzes and took attendance often which gave a good boost in my grade.
Attendance is classwork
This man is absolutely ruthless takes points off of everything, tiny mistake will cost you a lot of points. I don't know who said he is caring, he does not gaf will not accommodate.

Professor Deutsch was an excellent calculus II professor! He was always there to help when needed and encouraged you to ask questions. Calc 2 is hard but, the material was not as hard to me because of his explanations. I think he did a very good job at explaining things. There was usually weekly quizzes and weekly homework. Definitely recommend.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Weekly quizzes on Friday that I definitely recommend studying for. The tests were pretty hard in my opinion just because I'm used to study guides being exactly like that test, and his were somewhat different. Weekly homework that are time consuming so prepare ahead. He's super nice so if you put in the work an A is definitely possible!

I love this professor so much. He answered emails and homework help questions so fast. He was a charismatic lecturer too. He gives weekly (short) quizzes on fridays and weekly homework (usually a very normal amount of it). He made sure we were prepared for tests (allowed a notecard cheat sheet). For the final, he allowed a full page cheat sheet too

such a picky grader, if you don't work problems out the way he does he will take points off. if you don't round the way he does expect points off. weekly quizzes with only a couple of questions. takes off points for the WILDEST things tbh and sooo much homework
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Extremely difficult course. I wouldn't recommend taking him if you take a little longer to catch onto things. He is very picky with his grading and will take off just because you forgot an equal sign or something really small that doesn't matter even though your answer is correct. It just felt like the exams were based on what he knew and not us.

Math isn't my forte but I actually enjoy coming to his class. His guided notes are great. There's just a lot of homework, weekly quizzes, and the exams are tough. He teaches like everyone is a math major. Take someone easier if you don't love math. If math is your thing, you will do great in here.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: very nice, accessible, and approachable guy and has a sense of humor. i took him for precalc and the lectures are simple and easy to understand.  bonus points on the tests + he replaces your lowest test grade with the grade you get on the final. suuuper easy if you just attend class, take notes, and do the ALEKS HW
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Deutsch was fantastic! Honestly, his teaching is great and he explains the content very well. His tests are exactly what he went over in class and the homework. This class is homework-heavy, so you must set aside time to complete it. As long as you attend class and pay attention, you'll be fine. His office hour timings are great as well.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Deutsch is a great professor!  The material is difficult to learn, but he really tries to teach you and helps you understand the subject the best he can.  Attend his class and his studying sessions and you will do fine.  Ask questions and he will spend time with you.  I would definitely take his class again and I would highly recommend him!
He really made sure that everyone understood the material. He's really nice and kinda funny. There were times where I thought he was going so slow, but other students needed it.

He is a good professor when he explains the material. He is a very picky grader when it comes to exams and  quizzes. You could the question right but get a point off because something was not written correctly. His office hours are ok but you can rarely get him to help you during that time.

I never write these but Dr. Deutsch is the best calc professor ever. He explains things so well a middle schooler could take this class. Tests and quizzes are easier than the homework and he allows a formula sheet on exams. Extremely available outside of class and will help you until you understand if you ask for help.100% take him if you can!!

Had him for Calc for Life Sci and he is by far the best math professor I have ever taken. Dedicates A LOT of time outside of class to students, allows notecards on exams, offers a huge extra credit assignment at the end of the semester and overall wants you to succeed. Nice guy & great prof. If you go to class and do the work youre gold. Take him!!

This is the best, smartest, most well-spoken, and most caring calc professor you will get. I took the first semester of Calculus for Life Sciences MATH 1179 (Fall 2023). The material is hard and fast paced. Passing calc requires a lot of work in and out of class. If you put in the effort to get help, he will help you. 100% take him.
Terrible teacher.

He's a cool guy who is very clearly passionate about teaching. Although, the more difficult content he doesn't cover very much and he goes very fast and at times its difficult to keep up, even just actively listening. He's a very picky grader when it comes to tests and quizzes, so make sure you prioritize meticulous studying.

I love Dr. Deutsch--I took him for Calc I--but this class is so hard. He pushes understanding equations and concepts so heavily vs just knowing how to do the math. Most students are taking this for credit in non-math-related majors and I wish he understood that. Also, the homework is often way harder than the quizzes, so it takes forever to do.

Since it is an online class most of the lectures are online. However, he has a lot of office hours every week and review sessions before the tests and finals. HW was online and you pretty much have infinite tries for it so it's easy to get a 100 if you put in enough effort. Overall for a class where I expected a C and instead got a B, I'm happy.

Not really sure why so many like him... he teaches/ talks like we're in middle school. Goes through the difficult topics too quickly. He isn't flexible. Attendance impacts his grading! I will say- he has great office hours.
Took him for calc one and two. Amazing guy and really easy to get ahold on outside class. He loves what he's doing and teaches really well. It's very hard to fail his class.

Professor Deutsch was great he helped when you asked his tests are 1000x easier than the homework. Yeah the homework takes about an hour to do but his tests are super easy and he only puts problems similar to the ones he goes over in class. 100% recommend.

I took calc 1 this past fall semester and you can tell he is a cool guy. I just do not think he knows that some people just simply do not understand math, let alone calc. He would fly through hard problems but spend a long time on easy things. Good professor, I do not know about outstanding. It is just hard material
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: He has weekly homework assignments and uses printed notes for lectures. If you don't come to class you won't do well on the exams, but he teaches what will be tested on and he gives several opportunities to help your grade (usually through bonus questions).

The best math professor I have ever had thus far. He is the best person to teach because he breaks the content down so well and explains so good. Also he make sure that everyone understands the topic and will spend most of class helping students understand even if it means that we'll be a little behind but I love that about him.

Deutsch is awesome. Calc 2 is a hard class and he made it passable. I will say I spent an absurd amount of time on homework for this class but that's to be expected. He hosts office hours 3 times a week and explains concepts well.
one of the best math professors ive every had. Great at explaining the topics and has a lot of resources.

Very clear lectures, lots of weekly homework, and a quiz pretty much every week. The guy has a true passion for what he does and really displays it as he teaches. He loves to answer questions and is pretty much always available to help outside of class. Great calc teacher, I'm taking him for calc 2 in the spring.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof. Deutsch was clear when it came to lectures and assignments. Not a lot of homework and we had in-class notes. Also participation matters but it did not affect my grade too much. If you practice the homework (which was on Aleks) you'll be fine for the test Would 100% take it again.
Good for an online class. Holds lots of extra office hours that really help. Tests are easy after studying the practice tests.

Took this class for summer credit for precal. He will subtract 20% of the grade if you don't fit in the camera the right way or submit the shown work late. He is just another professor who finds joy in hurting people's grades for little things and not based on if you actually know the work or not. Do yourself a favor and avoid this class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I'm a senior taking a summer precalc with him and freshmen. Literally worst professor I've ever had and I'm lowkey good at math. The homework is relentless, there is 5 tests where he is so picky about how you look on camera. He doesn't show up for zoom office hours, doesn't teach, shoutout to my highschool precalc teacher, i'm just tryna pass now

Professor Deutsch gives mazing lectures and is always willing to stop the class at any point to answer any questions because he cares. He also provides help sessions for students still struggling. The class's attendance is mandatory. Homework heavy class! Final exam replaces your lowest test grade. There is also some extra credit that helps a lot.

Professor Deutsch is a good teacher but he grades really tough. If you're good at algebra and have your trig down you shouldn't have too much trouble in this course- but if you're like me and math isn't easy you will struggle! Tests avg 70% of your overall grade so if you don't do well on the tests you're doomed. No formula sheet/notes for tests
Good communicator

Overall, His lectures are pretty good and they are mandatory to go to if you want an A. ALEXS homework is very annoying every week but it does help. I didn't like how few questions were on the test and make sure you know your math definitions and know the material well before taking them.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Deutsch really nice and cares about his students grades. He allows a lot of time outside of class for students to meet with him if they are struggling. Attendance is mandatory if you want to get a good grade and understand the content. Theres homework on ALEKS once a week that takes around 2hrs and on the test you're allowed a notecard.

Professor Deutsch is very nice and gets back to you as soon as possible with emails. However, the class is VERY fast paced with not a lot of explaining on class work. There is ALEKS homework every week which can be overwhelming if you have other classes with homework due the same week.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Its an easy class and hes a chill professor. He emails back and has office hours, and he knows how to explain the material well. The class gets harder and the notes were not like the test (the test was harder) and same thing with the homework, it was harder than the notes. Hes a great teacher over all but definitely dedicate time into studying.

Professor Deutsch is my favorite prof by far. He gives guided notes every week, hes super caring and he really wants you to succeed. Homework and attendance are a good portion of your grade so even if you dont do super well on the tests you can still make a good grade. Show up to class and do the aleks homework and you will make an A.

He explains things very well, almost overexplains things at times. He continuously helps his students and even has office hours to help explain the materials to students who do not understand. As long as you go to class, then this should be an easy A if you have a decent knowledge of math already.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Deutsch is a good teacher. Sometimes he does over-explain the concepts but it's just because he wants you to get and he really loves math. There's ALEKS homework due every week as well as knowledge checks. They're easy as long as you don't get behind. His tests are also fairly simple.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great teacher, gives you guided notes and completes them with you. He cares about his students and wants them to understand. Yes he uses aleks but he is plenty available during his office hours. He does go a little fast but just ask him to slow down and he will. 10/10 recommend him.

One of the best math teachers I have ever had. Super helpful and available during office hours and he's super kind. I'm pretty bad at math but he did help make the class more enjoyable. Just make sure you always show up for class and do the ALEKS homework!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Nice guy. He makes the work very clear and does every single problem on the board in order for everyone to understand it. He makes jokes here and there and laughs along with his students from time to time. The work gets harder as the semester goes on, but overall this is a pretty good class and professor.
